tag_narrative: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
title_narrative: Syrien-Irak 2022-2025. United Nations Mine Action Services (UNMAS)
sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
result_title_narrative: 2) National NGO's implement MA priority tasks effectively with funds from the Government of Iraq and international donors.
3.1 Clearance capacity is tasked to EO affected areas
1.3 National Mine Action Authorities and MA stakeholders have increased capacity and capability to execute their mandate in managing the sector
3.2 Risk education/ awareness delivered to at-risk communities.
3) Land is released for safe return of displaced persons and development activities and people are able to mitigate the risks from explosive ordnance.
1.4  NMAAs has enhanced and developed systems and processes to facilitate MA activities across Iraq
1.1 Resource mobilisation and donor engagement strategy/plan developed and/or enhanced and is implemented in coordination with UNMAS.

1) The Government of Iraq manages an efficient mine action sector that protects civilians from threat of explosive ordnance and enables stabilization and development efforts to proceed unimpeded by explosive ordnance.
2 N National operators have increased capacity to deliver mine action activities. (national operators: national companies and NGOs)
1.2 NMAAs lead and coordinate the MA sector effectively
3.3 Improved tailored EORE messaging and materials to facilitate behaviour change with the purpose of mitigating the risk of EO.

result_indicator_title_narrative:
2.1) Number of national NGOs trained through UNMAS Iraq partnership grants to meet the standards to compete successfully for UN grants and bilateral funding. 

2.2) Number of engagements to advocate for National NGOs grants and funding either provided bilaterally, by UNMAS and/or by other donors.

2.3) Number of priority tasks completed by National NGOs with UN and bilateral funding.

1.  Number of m2 released through survey and clearance (disaggregated by type, location, organisation type)(Means of verification: IMSMA completion report) 

2. # of EO removed (disaggregated by type, location, organisation type) (Means of verification: IMSMA completion report) 

3. % of UNMAS QA that demonstrate compliance with IMAS / NMAS quality standards for clearance (Means of verification: QM report)

1) number of people trained in thematic/technical training courses
2) number of thematic/technical training courses with NMAA/MA stakeholders participating 
3) number of  trainers training courses for the Ministry of Iraq

1. # of girls, boys, women and men who received risk education (sex and age disaggregated) 

2. # of risk education/awareness sessions delivered (disaggregated by type) 

3. # at-risk humanitarian, stabilization and development workers trained to mitigate EO risks in hazardous working environments (type, sex and age disaggregated).

3.1) Number of square meters of land made safe for development activities. 

3.2) Number of sites/locations where access has been enabled to restore or facilitate use.

3.3) Percentage of the +1 mio. displaced people from liberated areas have safely returned to their places of origin and demonstrate and increase in knowledge of safe practices. 

3.4) Percentage of EORE beneficiaries that demonstrate an increase in knowledge between unsafe and safe practices.

1) Number of system and processes enhanced and developed for DMA by UNMAS

2) Number of NMAS officially released accredited  with the new updates
Number of workshops for DMA/IKMAA with donors

1.1) Government of Iraq describes full scope and scale of contamination in Iraq to relevant treaty forums.

1.2)  Number of interventions to assist Iraq NMAS to be aligned with IMAS. 

1.3) Number of high-level advocacy meetings and/or workshops for the Iraqi MA sector consistently, sustainably founded through federal budget allocations supported by bilateral contributions and projects co-funded with Government of Iraq federal and international bilateral contributions. 

1.4) Number of workshops and engagements to assist DMA to develop transparent and timely tasking for the sector operators.  

1.5)  Number of Government of Iraq entities or personnel who reports increased.

1) Percentage of female workers fulfilling roles within national teams of national operators disaggregated by role and type number of risk education/awareness sessions delivered (disaggregated by type)

2) Number of capacity development initiatives and engagement delivered to enhance the organisational capacities of the national NGO (initiatives/engagement: policies, trainings, coaching, meetings)

1) number of coordination forums supported by UNMAS
2) number of strategic mine action issues resolved through support and advocacy from UNMAS (define strategic MA issues - Policy and Operational: access, positioning of DMA, security, inter-agency/gov't relations)

1. # of behaviour change communication study and strategy conducted 

2. # of new Information Education, Communication (IEC) materials developed 

3. # of newly developed IEC materials endorsed by DMA to use by IPs
